intro: Xerodraba pycnophylloides, commonly known as the dense-leaved sandburs, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, spiny fruits. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed, providing a dense foliage that helps reduce water loss. It produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the late spring and early summer. Xerodraba pycnophylloides is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
